alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Greer; Kiowa; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 10:27AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Washita, southeastern Roger Mills, Custer, northern Kiowa, northeastern Greer and Beckham Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1027 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Moorewood to near Elk City to near Erick. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Sayre, Hobart, Cordell, Cheyenne, Burns Flat, Thomas, Erick, Sentinel, Arapaho, Mountain View, Hammon, Dill City, Canute, Corn, Custer City, Butler, and Carter. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 1 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Custer; Greer; Kiowa; Roger Mills; Washita
